text: (upbeat music)

- My name is Prashant, I
am a Software Engineer too
at AWS X-Ray Team, and I've been with AWS
for about two and half years now.
(upbeat music)

The coolest thing about X-Ray
is that we develop tools

for developers, so it's part
of the monitoring toolkit
in AWS Observability Suite,

so it's a distributed
tracing service, which lets

other developers to have
like distributed application,

kind of trace where each
of their request is going.
I'm actually from India.

I moved to the US to
do my graduate studies,
and I was working with a company

after my graduation and
there it was a new team,
they were building a new product

of data lake and that happened
to be completely on AWS.
And that was the first time
I'd actually got introduced to X-ray.

After about one year, I was
reached out by a recruiter
for a position at the X-ray team

and I interviewed and
that's how I ended up here.
If a candidate is thinking of joining AWS
and has certain kind of passions,
we definitely bring them to the team,

because we definitely
encourage passionate people.
Big projects that needs to be solved,
if you don't have ownership,
then projects would probably go and fail,

but just passion to drive the
project or something you own,
it's really valuable.
(upbeat music)
